intro: Mitscherlichia repens, commonly known as the creeping mitscherlichia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features prostrate stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in spikes, typically blooming in late summer.
